snippet: The All-Star Game’s television audience has been cut in half over the last 20 years, and now the game draws a smaller audience than do many episodes of “The Walking Dead” on AMC.
abstract: Richard Sandomir TV Sports column notes that baseball's All-Star Game is soon to overtaken by the Home Run Derby as television event; All-Star Game attracted 22 million viewers 20 years ago; in 2013, it attracted 10.95 million viewers, second fewest recorded by Nielsen; between 1995 and 2013, viewership for the Derby has risen.
lead_paragraph: The All-Star Game’s television audience has been cut in half over the last 20 years, and now the game draws a smaller audience than do many episodes of “The Walking Dead” on AMC.

headline.seo: Home Run Derby 2014 Looks Enticing Compared to the Main Event
headline.main: Baseball All-Stars Take Field, but Fewer People Tune In
headline.print_headline: Baseball Stars Take Field, but Fewer People Tune In
